item.title: 562 givepoints
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

When you have something like this, you can’t read the username and another integer in the same command. Why? Because, as Project stated, the command is split using spaces. So if a name has spaces, it will consider each part of the username is a different part of the command.

I avoided this in my server by forcing the command-typer to use ‘_’ instead of spaces in the username, and then changing it back server sided:

PlayerItems pi = new PlayerItems(); String person = (cmd[1].replace("_", " ")); Player p2 = Engine.players[Engine.getIdFromName(person)]; int itemID = Integer.parseInt(cmd[2]); if (p2 != null) { int itemamt = Integer.parseInt(cmd[3]); Engine.playerItems.deleteItem(p2, itemID, getItemSlot(p2, itemID),itemamt); }The important lines are 2-4. See what I did?

For your command:

if(cmd[0].equals("givepoints")) { Player other = World.getInstance().getPlayerList().get(World.getInstance().getIdFromName(command[1].replaceAll("_", " "))); //EX: ::givepoints david_insley 56; instead of ::givepoints David Insley 56 if (other != null) { other.PkPoints += Integer.valueOf(cmd[2]); //Adds the number of PK points to the users current points } }

Read full topic

item.title: 562 givepoints
item.dc:creator: @Project_Realm Project Realm
item.description:
@Project_Realm wrote:

I’m assuming “cmd” is a String array of portions of the original command, separated by spaces?

The problem with the command is this: what if I typed in “givepoints a player 2”? The username is “A Player”, and the amount is 2. However, the way you coded it, “A” would be treated as the username and “Player” would be treated as the amount. The String “Player” cannot be parsed into an int, therefore throwing an error.

Maybe that’s why it’s not working?

Read full topic

item.title: 562 givepoints
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

I suppose you could replace this

Player other = World.getInstance().getPlayerList().get(World.getInstance().getIdFromName(command.substring((command.indexOf(" ") + 1))));

With this

Player other = World.getInstance().getPlayerList().get(World.getInstance().getIdFromName(cmd[1]);
